intro: Ferdinandusa panamensis, commonly known as the Panamanian fernwood, is a tropical tree native to Central America. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests. Its bark contains compounds that have been studied for potential medicinal properties. Ferdinandusa panamensis plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and contributing to biodiversity.
